sections.offense: Act done by a person bound by law
sections.punishment: No offense if done in good faith under legal obligation

sections.punishment: No offense if done in the exercise of judicial functions

sections.punishment: No offense if done under authority of a Court

sections.punishment: No offense if intoxication was involuntary

sections.punishment: Liable if intoxication was voluntary

sections.offense: Definition of Abetment
sections.punishment: A person abets an offense if they instigate, engage in a conspiracy, or aid the commission of the offense.

sections.offense: Definition of Abettor
sections.punishment: A person who abets an offense is an abettor, even if the main offense is not committed.

sections.offense: Abetment outside India
sections.punishment: A person abetting an offense outside India is still punishable under IPC.

sections.offense: Punishment for Abetment if the Act Abetted is Committed
sections.punishment: Same punishment as the main offense if committed as a result of abetment.

sections.offense: Punishment for Abetment if the Act Abetted is Committed with a Different Intention
sections.punishment: Punishment depends on the intention of the act committed.

sections.offense: Liability of Abettor When Different Act is Done
sections.punishment: Abettor is liable if the act abetted leads to a different but probable consequence.

sections.offense: Abettor Liable for Cumulative Punishment
sections.punishment: If abettor is responsible for multiple offenses, they receive cumulative punishment.

sections.offense: Liability of Abettor for Effect of Act Abetted
sections.punishment: Abettor is liable for consequences of the act they abet.

sections.offense: Abettor Present When Offense is Committed
sections.punishment: Abettor is treated as if they committed the offense themselves.

sections.offense: Abetment of Offense Punishable with Death or Life Imprisonment If the Offense is Not Committed
sections.punishment: Up to 7 years imprisonment and fine.

sections.offense: Abetment of Offense Punishable with Imprisonment If the Offense is Not Committed
sections.punishment: Up to half the punishment of the main offense.

sections.offense: Abetment of Offense by the Public or More than 10 Persons
sections.punishment: Up to 3 years imprisonment or fine or both.

sections.offense: Concealing Design to Commit an Offense Punishable with Death or Life Imprisonment
sections.punishment: Up to 10 years imprisonment or fine.

sections.offense: Public Servant Concealing Design to Commit an Offense
sections.punishment: Punishment varies based on offense concealed.

sections.offense: Concealing Design to Commit an Offense Punishable with Imprisonment
sections.punishment: Up to one-fourth of the punishment for the main offense.

sections.offense: Definition of Criminal Conspiracy
sections.punishment: When two or more persons agree to commit an illegal act or a legal act by illegal means, it is criminal conspiracy.

sections.offense: Punishment for Criminal Conspiracy

punishment.If the offense conspired is punishable w: Punishment is the same as the main offense.
punishment.For other cases: Up to 6 months imprisonment or fine or both.

sections.offense: Waging, or Attempting to Wage War Against the Government of India
sections.punishment: Punishable with death, or life imprisonment, and fine.

sections.offense: Conspiracy to Commit Offenses Punishable by Section 121
sections.punishment: Punishable with life imprisonment, or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Collecting Arms for Waging War Against the Government of India

sections.offense: Concealing Design to Wage War Against the Government of India

sections.punishment: Punishable with imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Sedition

sections.offense: Waging War Against the Government of Any Friendly State
sections.punishment: Punishable with life imprisonment, or imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Using as True Such Declaration Knowing It to Be False
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Causing Disappearance of Evidence of Offense or Giving False Information to Screen Offender
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Intentional Omission to Give Information of Offense by Person Bound to Inform
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Giving False Information Respecting an Offense Committed
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Destruction of Document to Prevent Its Production as Evidence
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: False Personation for Purpose of Act or Proceeding in Suit or Prosecution
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Fraudulent Removal or Concealment of Property to Prevent Seizure
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Fraudulent Claim to Property to Prevent Seizure
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Fraudulently Suffering Decree for Sum Not Due
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Dishonestly Making False Claim in Court
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Fraudulently Obtaining Decree for Sum Not Due
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine.

sections.offense: False Charge of Offense Made with Intent to Injure
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Harboring Offender
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Taking Gift to Screen Offender from Punishment
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Offering Gift to Screen Offender from Punishment
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Taking Gift to Help in Recovery of Stolen Property
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Harboring Offender Who Has Escaped from Custody or Whom He Knows to Be Liable to Imprisonment
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Public Servant Disobeying Law with Intent to Save Person from Punishment or Property from Forfeiture
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Public Servant Framing Incorrect Record or Writing with Intent to Save Person from Punishment or Property from Forfeiture
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Public Servant in Judicial Proceeding Corruptly Making Report Contrary to Law
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Commitment for Trial or Confinement by Person Having Authority Who Knows That He is Acting Contrary to Law
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Intentional Omission to Apprehend on Part of Public Servant Bound to Apprehend
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Intentional Omission to Apprehend on Part of Public Servant Bound to Apprehend Person under Sentence or Lawfully Committed
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Escape from Confinement or Custody Negligently Suffered by Public Servant
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Resistance or Obstruction to Lawful Apprehension of Oneself
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

chapters.title: Offenses Relating to Coins and Government Stamps

sections.offense: Definition of 'Coin'
sections.description: Coin includes metal stamped by government authority for use as money and extends to foreign coins.

sections.offense: Counterfeiting Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Counterfeiting Indian Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment for life, or up to 10 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Making or Selling Instruments for Counterfeiting Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Making or Selling Instruments for Counterfeiting Indian Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment for life, or up to 10 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Possession of Instruments or Materials for Counterfeiting Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Abetting Counterfeiting of Coin Outside India
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Import or Export of Counterfeit Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Import or Export of Counterfeit Indian Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment for life, or up to 10 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Delivery of Counterfeit Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years and fine.

sections.offense: Delivery of Counterfeit Indian Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Delivery of Counterfeit Coin by a Person Who Knew It to Be Counterfeit
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years and fine.

sections.offense: Possession of Counterfeit Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine.

sections.offense: Possession of Counterfeit Indian Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Person Possessing Counterfeit Coin with Knowledge
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year and fine.

sections.offense: Unlawful Alteration of Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine.

sections.offense: Unlawful Alteration of Indian Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Possession of Altered Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years and fine.

sections.offense: Possession of Altered Indian Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine.

sections.offense: Altering Appearance of Coin to Pass as Different Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 5 years and fine.

sections.offense: Altering Appearance of Indian Coin to Pass as Different Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Dealing in Altered Coin
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine.

sections.offense: Possession of Altered Coin with Intent to Use Fraudulently
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine.

sections.offense: Counterfeiting Government Stamps
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Possession of Counterfeit Government Stamps
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Making or Selling Instruments for Forging Stamps
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Possession of Instruments for Forging Stamps
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Making or Selling Adulterated Government Stamps
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Possession of Adulterated Government Stamps
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Using a Government Stamp Known to Be Counterfeit
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Using a Government Stamp Known to Be Previously Used
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years and fine.

sections.offense: Effacing Writing from Government Stamp
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine.

sections.offense: Using a Stamp Known to Have Been Previously Used
sections.punishment: Impisonment up to 2 years and fine.

sections.offense: Erasure of Mark Denoting Stamp Has Been Used
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine.

sections.offense: Prohibition of Fake Stamps and Sale Without Authority
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

chapters.title: Offenses Relating to Weights and Measures

sections.offense: Fraudulent Use of False Instrument for Weighing
sections.description: Whoever fraudulently uses any instrument for weighing that he knows to be false shall be punished.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Fraudulent Use of False Weight or Measure
sections.description: Whoever fraudulently uses any false weight or false measure of length or capacity shall be punished.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Being in Possession of False Weight or Measure
sections.description: Whoever is in possession of any instrument for weighing, weight, or measure which he knows to be false and intends to use fraudulently shall be punished.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Making or Selling False Weight or Measure
sections.description: Whoever makes, sells, or disposes of any instrument for weighing, weight, or measure which he knows to be false shall be punished.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.

chapters.title: Offenses Affecting Public Health, Safety, Convenience, Decency, and Morals

sections.offense: Public Nuisance
sections.description: A person is guilty of public nuisance if they cause common injury, danger, or annoyance to the public.
sections.punishment: Fine.

sections.offense: Negligent Act Likely to Spread Infection of Disease Dangerous to Life
sections.description: Whoever unlawfully or negligently does any act which is likely to spread a disease dangerous to life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Malignant Act Likely to Spread Infection of Disease Dangerous to Life
sections.description: Whoever malignantly does any act which is likely to spread a disease dangerous to life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Disobedience to Quarantine Rule
sections.description: Whoever knowingly disobeys a quarantine rule imposed by public authorities.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Adulteration of Food or Drink Intended for Sale
sections.description: Whoever adulterates food or drink intended for sale, making it harmful for consumption.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Sale of Noxious Food or Drink
sections.description: Whoever sells or offers noxious food or drink for sale.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Adulteration of Drugs
sections.description: Whoever adulterates drugs, making them harmful for consumption.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Sale of Adulterated Drugs
sections.description: Whoever knowingly sells adulterated drugs that are dangerous to life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Sale of Drug as a Different Drug
sections.description: Whoever knowingly sells a drug as a different drug than what it actually is.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Fouling Water of Public Spring or Reservoir
sections.description: Whoever corrupts or fouls the water of any public spring or reservoir.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Making Atmosphere Noxious to Health
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily vitiates the atmosphere in any place making it noxious to health.
sections.punishment: Fine up to Rs. 500.

sections.offense: Rash Driving or Riding on a Public Way
sections.description: Whoever drives or rides on a public way in a manner rash or negligent so as to endanger human life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Rash Navigation of Vessel
sections.description: Whoever navigates any vessel in a manner rash or negligent so as to endanger human life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Exhibition of False Light, Mark, or Buoy
sections.description: Whoever exhibits any false light, mark, or buoy with intent to mislead navigators.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine.

sections.offense: Conveying Person by Water for Hire in Unsafe or Overloaded Vessel
sections.description: Whoever knowingly carries people in an unsafe or overloaded vessel for hire.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Danger or Obstruction in Public Way or Line of Navigation
sections.description: Whoever causes danger, obstruction, or injury in a public way or water channel.
sections.punishment: Fine up to Rs. 200.

sections.offense: Negligent Conduct with Respect to Poisonous Substances
sections.description: Whoever negligently handles poisonous substances, endangering human life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Negligent Conduct with Respect to Fire or Combustible Matter
sections.description: Whoever handles fire or combustible material negligently, endangering life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Negligent Conduct with Respect to Explosive Substance
sections.description: Whoever handles explosive substances negligently, endangering human life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Negligent Conduct with Respect to Machinery
sections.description: Whoever operates machinery negligently, endangering human life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Negligent Conduct with Respect to Building Demolition
sections.description: Whoever carries out demolition negligently, endangering human life.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Negligent Conduct with Respect to Animal
sections.description: Whoever negligently lets loose an animal likely to cause injury.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to Rs. 1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Punishment for Public Nuisance in Cases Not Otherwise Provided For
sections.description: Whoever commits a public nuisance in cases not covered elsewhere.
sections.punishment: Fine up to Rs. 200.

sections.offense: Continuance of Nuisance after Injunction to Discontinue
sections.description: Whoever continues a public nuisance after an injunction to stop.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Sale of Obscene Books, Etc.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Sale of Obscene Objects to Young Persons
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Keeping a Lottery Office
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Injuring or Defiling Place of Worship with Intent to Insult the Religion of Any Class
sections.description: Whoever destroys, damages, or defiles any place of worship or any object held sacred with the intention of insulting the religion of any class of persons.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Deliberate and Malicious Acts Intended to Outrage Religious Feelings
sections.description: Whoever, with deliberate and malicious intention, outrages the religious feelings of any class by insulting their religion or religious beliefs.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Disturbing Religious Assembly
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes disturbance to any lawful religious assembly.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Trespassing on Burial Places, Hurting Religious Feelings
sections.description: Whoever trespasses on burial grounds with intent to wound religious feelings or insult any religion.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Uttering Words, Making Gestures with Intent to Wound Religious Feelings
sections.description: Whoever, with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings, utters words or makes gestures to insult the religion of any person.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Culpable Homicide
sections.description: Causing death by an act with the intention of causing death or bodily injury.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Murder
sections.description: Culpable homicide amounting to murder with deliberate intention.
sections.punishment: Death sentence or life imprisonment and fine.

sections.offense: Punishment for Murder
sections.description: Whoever commits murder.
sections.punishment: Death penalty or life imprisonment and fine.

sections.offense: Culpable Homicide Not Amounting to Murder
sections.description: Causing death without premeditation but with knowledge that it could cause death.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, or life imprisonment, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Ca using Death by Negligence
sections.description: Causing death by a rash or negligent act, not amounting to culpable homicide.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Abetment of Suicide of Child or Insane Person
sections.description: Whoever abets the suicide of a person under 18 years of age, an insane person, a delirious person, an idiot, or a person in a state of intoxication.
sections.punishment: Death penalty or life imprisonment, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Abetment of Suicide
sections.description: If any person commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Attempt to Murder
sections.description: Whoever attempts to murder with the intent to cause death.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine; if hurt is caused, life imprisonment.

sections.offense: Attempt to Commit Culpable Homicide
sections.description: Attempting culpable homicide not amounting to murder.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine; if hurt is caused, up to 10 years.

sections.offense: Attempt to Commit Suicide
sections.description: Whoever attempts to commit suicide and does any act towards its commission.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Thug
sections.description: Whoever, at any time after the passing of this Act, is proved to be a thug.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment for life and fine.

sections.offense: Punishment for Being a Thug
sections.description: Whoever is a thug shall be punished accordingly.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment for life and fine.

sections.offense: Causing Miscarriage
sections.description: Voluntarily causing a woman to miscarry without lawful justification.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Causing Miscarriage Without Woman's Consent
sections.description: Whoever causes miscarriage of a woman without her consent, whether she is quick with child or not.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Death Caused by Act Done with Intent to Cause Miscarriage
sections.description: Whoever, with intent to cause miscarriage, does any act which causes the death of the woman.
sections.punishment: If done without the womanâ€™s consent: Imprisonment for life, or up to 10 years, and fine. If done with consent: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Act Done with Intent to Prevent Child from Being Born Alive
sections.description: Doing an act with the intent to prevent a child from being born or cause its death after birth.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Causing Death of Quick Unborn Child by Act Amounting to Culpable Homicide
sections.description: Whoever does any act with intent to cause the death of a quick unborn child, if such act amounts to culpable homicide if it resulted in death.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Exposure and Abandonment of Child Under Twelve Years, by Parent or Person Having Care of It
sections.description: Whoever, being the father or mother of a child under twelve years, or having care of such child, exposes or leaves the child in any place with intent to abandon it.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Concealment of Birth by Secret Disposal of Dead Body
sections.description: Whoever, to conceal the birth of a child, secretly disposes of the dead body of the child, whether the child dies before, during, or after birth.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Hurt
sections.description: Causing bodily pain, disease, or infirmity to any person.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to â‚¹1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Grievous Hurt
sections.description: Causing injuries such as permanent disfigurement, bone fractures, or severe bodily harm.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Hurt
sections.description: Whoever does any act with the intention of causing hurt to any person, or with the knowledge that he is likely thereby to cause hurt to any person.
sections.punishment: Punishable under Section 323.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt, and the hurt inflicted is grievous as defined in Section 320.
sections.punishment: Punishable under Section 325.

sections.offense: Punishment for Voluntarily Causing Hurt
sections.description: Voluntarily causing hurt to another person.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to â‚¹1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Hurt by Dangerous Weapons
sections.description: Causing hurt using a weapon or means likely to cause death.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Punishment for Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt as defined in Section 320.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt by Dangerous Weapons
sections.description: Causing grievous hurt using a deadly weapon.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to life, or up to 10 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Hurt to Extort Property or to Constrain to an Illegal Act
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to any person to extort any property or valuable security or to constrain them to do something illegal.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Causing Hurt by Means of Poison, etc., with Intent to Commit an Offense
sections.description: Whoever administers or causes to be taken any poison or any stupefying, intoxicating, or unwholesome drug with intent to commit or facilitate an offense.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt to Extort Property or to Constrain to an Illegal Act
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to extort property or valuable security or to constrain them to do something illegal.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment for life or imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Hurt to Extort Confession or to Compel Restoration of Property
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to any person to extort a confession or information leading to the detection of an offense or misconduct.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt to Extort Confession or to Compel Restoration of Property
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to any person to extort a confession or information leading to the detection of an offense or misconduct.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Hurt to Deter Public Servant
sections.description: Causing hurt to a public servant to obstruct them from duty.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years and fine.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt to Deter Public Servant from His Duty
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to a public servant in the discharge of their duty or to deter them from discharging their duty.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Hurt on Provocation
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt on grave and sudden provocation, provided the provocation was not sought or voluntarily provoked.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to â‚¹500, or both.

sections.offense: Voluntarily Causing Grievous Hurt on Provocation
sections.description: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation, provided the provocation was not sought or voluntarily provoked.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 4 years, or fine up to â‚¹2,000, or both.

sections.offense: Act Endangering Life or Personal Safety of Others
sections.description: Committing a rash or negligent act endangering human life or safety.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to â‚¹250, or both.

sections.offense: Causing Hurt by Act Endangering Life or Personal Safety of Others
sections.description: Whoever causes hurt to any person by doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to â‚¹500, or both.

sections.offense: Causing Grievous Hurt by Act Endangering Life or Safety
sections.description: Causing grievous hurt through a rash or negligent act.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine up to â‚¹1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Wrongful Restraint
sections.description: Obstructing someone to prevent them from proceeding in a lawful direction.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to â‚¹500, or both.

sections.offense: Wrongful Confinement
sections.description: Wrongfully restraining someone in a way that prevents them from moving beyond certain limits.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to â‚¹1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Punishment for Wrongful Restraint
sections.description: Wrongfully restraining any person from proceeding in a lawful direction.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to â‚¹500, or both.

sections.offense: Punishment for Wrongful Confinement
sections.description: Wrongfully confining any person in a manner preventing them from moving beyond certain limits.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine up to â‚¹1,000, or both.

sections.offense: Wrongful Confinement for Three or More Days
sections.description: Confining a person for three or more days without legal justification.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Wrongful Confinement for Ten or More Days
sections.description: Confining a person for ten or more days without legal justification.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Wrongful Confinement of a Person for the Purpose of Extorting Confession
sections.description: Confining a person to extort confession or property.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Wrongful Confinement in Secret
sections.description: Keeping someone confined secretly to prevent knowledge of their whereabouts.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Wrongful Confinement to Extort Property
sections.description: Confining someone to extort property or valuable security.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Wrongful Confinement to Extort Confession
sections.description: Confining someone to extort a confession or compel restoration of property.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Force
sections.description: Using force against a person to cause motion or prevent motion.
sections.punishment: Defined as an act, not punishable separately.

sections.offense: Criminal Force
sections.description: Intentionally using force on a person without their consent.
sections.punishment: Defined as an act, not punishable separately.

sections.offense: Assault
sections.description: Threatening or attempting to use criminal force without consent.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to â‚¹500, or both.

sections.offense: Punishment for Assault or Criminal Force
sections.description: Use of criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to â‚¹500, or both.

sections.offense: Assault or Criminal Force to Deter a Public Servant from Discharge of Duty
sections.description: Using force to prevent a public servant from doing their duty.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Assault or Criminal Force to a Woman with Intent to Outrage Her Modesty
sections.description: Using criminal force against a woman intending to outrage her modesty.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment between 1 and 5 years, and fine.

sections.offense: Assault or Criminal Force with Intent to Dishonor a Person
sections.description: Using criminal force to insult or dishonor a person.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Commit Theft
sections.description: Assaulting or using criminal force with intent to commit theft.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Assault or Criminal Force in Attempt to Wrongfully Confine a Person
sections.description: Using force to confine a person wrongfully.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Assault or Criminal Force on Grave Provocation
sections.description: Using force due to provocation, not amounting to murder.

sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Fraudulent Removal or Concealment of Property
sections.description: Fraudulently hiding or transferring property.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Fraudulent Execution of Deed of Transfer
sections.description: Executing a fraudulent deed of transfer.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both.

sections.offense: Attempt to Commit Offense Punishable with Imprisonment
sections.description: Attempting to commit an offense that is punishable with imprisonment.
sections.punishment: Imprisonment up to half of the maximum term for the offense attempted.
